intro: Dendrobium asphale, commonly known as the black orchid, is a species of orchid native to the Philippines. It is an epiphytic plant, meaning it grows on the surface of trees or other structures without being parasitic. The plant produces striking dark purple to black flowers that are highly ornamental. Its inflorescence typically consists of several blooms arranged along a single stem. Dendrobium asphale is valued in horticulture for its unique and dramatic floral display.
